background: Maple Oil processes different types of crude oil using compounds A and B to generate net revenue. The company aims to determine the quantity of each type of oil to process to maximize net revenue given the limitations of the available compounds.
constraints: Number of light oil tanks processed is non-negative
Number of non-sticky oil tanks processed is non-negative
Number of heavy oil tanks processed is non-negative
Consumption of compound A for light oil does not exceed TotalCompoundA
Consumption of compound B for light oil does not exceed TotalCompoundB
Total consumption of compound A for all oils does not exceed TotalCompoundA
Total consumption of compound B for all oils does not exceed TotalCompoundB
objective: Maximize the total net revenue from processing light oil, non-sticky oil, and heavy oil
description: Maple Oil processes three types of crude oil: light oil, non-sticky oil and heavy oil. Each tank of light oil produces a net revenue of \param{RevenueLight}, each tank of non-sticky oil produces a net revenue of \param{RevenueNonSticky}, and each tank of heavy oil produces a net revenue of \param{RevenueHeavy}. To process a tank of light oil, \param{CompoundALight} units of compound A and \param{CompoundBLight} units of compound B are required. To process a tank of non-sticky oil, \param{CompoundANonSticky} units of compound A and \param{CompoundBNonSticky} units of compound B are required. To process a tank of heavy oil, \param{CompoundAHeavy} units of compound A and \param{CompoundBHeavy} units of compound B are required. Currently the company has \param{TotalCompoundA} units of compound A and \param{TotalCompoundB} units of compound B to process. How many full or partial tanks of each oil should the company process so that net revenue is maximized?

parameters.definition: Net revenue from processing a tank of light oil
Net revenue from processing a tank of non-sticky oil
Net revenue from processing a tank of heavy oil
Units of compound A required to process a tank of light oil
Units of compound B required to process a tank of light oil
Units of compound A required to process a tank of non-sticky oil
Units of compound B required to process a tank of non-sticky oil
Units of compound A required to process a tank of heavy oil
Units of compound B required to process a tank of heavy oil
Total units of compound A available for processing
Total units of compound B available for processing
